Alright, let's break this down. Ante 2, Boss Blind, and I'm at 288 chips, needing 312 more within 3 hands. "Four Fingers" is my Joker, so flushes and straights can be made with 4 cards. Hearts are debuffed, but that's irrelevant here. My hand? I've got a pair of 10s of Diamonds, wait, three Gold 10s! Jackpot! Along with a Jack, 8, and 7 of Diamonds.

My immediate thoughts are, can I get enough value out of playing just three of the diamonds or will the other non gold cards in my hand get in the way?

Option 1. A Flush in Diamonds with Jack, two 10s, 8, 7 for 280 chips, plus my existing 288 is 568. Not enough.

Option 2. A Three of a Kind with the 10s could give me 180, which is also not enough.

Option 3. A 5-card Flush! Diamonds, Jack, and 10s, 8, and 7 would immediately win, for 608! Yes, I can do it.

However, I have those Gold Cards, three of the 10s! I have to consider money. Currently $2, at $3 per hand (3 left) and $2-3 interest per turn, this could easily earn $5-8. But those Gold cards would add $9. Do I play all three Gold cards for the instant win, or can I get the win without them? That is the question.

I have to get 312 without playing the Gold cards. I have two discard. Let's discard the 2 of Spades and Ace of Clubs. Hopefully, I can get a flush! I'll discard those two, then draw and aim for a Flush (Diamonds or Spades). If I get a 4-card Flush, I can't win.

However, if I play the current set, I play a flush with two 10s, 8, 7.  The remaining card in my hand is also useless, though.

If I play J, 10, 8, 7 I get 280 chips. This leaves me with 568. If I play this, I retain two Gold cards in hand! To retain the gold cards in my hand, I would need 32 more chips.

Wait. A 5-card flush with the Gold 10s is the play, guaranteeing the win AND leaving one Gold card for the bonus! Play Jack, 10, 10, 8, 7! 320 chips, 608 total. Bingo. Game over. I win the round and get $3.

I'm playing a flush with 5 cards: the Jack, two 10s, 8, and 7 of Diamonds. It's the most efficient way to win and keeps one of the Gold 10s, getting a bonus.

Final Answer: A 5-card Flush! Jack(3), 10(4), 10(5), 8(7), and 7(8). This will be 320 chips. I will have 608 chips total! I keep the Gold card!
